intro: Scorzonera polyclada, commonly known as the clustered scorzonera, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Scorzonera polyclada has a taproot that is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable plant for rocky or dry garden environments.
